Posts.Content: Sep 29, 2007 11:37AM momof5 wrote: Hi, Tender Thank you for your kind response.  I didn't realize it until later that the surgeon who ordered the breast mri has experience but doesn't specialize in breast concerns.  His specialty is bariatric bypass surgery.  I haven't had an appointment with a breast specialist yet.  I have that set for Oct 2. and last time I talked with her secretary, she said she was busy with surgery and they hadn't received my mammo, u/s and mri yet. I'm not sure when the biopsy will be.  They're supposed to be calling to set up the appointment.  Thank you for explaining the possibilities.  That makes a lot of sense and is helpful.  This seems like a very supportive place!  God bless.
Posts.Title: Just had a Breast MRI momof5 momof5

Posts.Content: momof5 wrote: Hi,  I'm 35 and had my first mammogram and ultra sound in August because I was having pain under my arm for several months.  They found an enlarged lymph node in the axillary area there and a 6mm nodule behind the nipple/areola that they were unsure about and recommended a repeat mammogram in 6 months.  I talked with a general surgeon and decided to opt for a bi-lateral breast mri rather than wait the 6 months.  This came back showing that those first two areas are both lymph nodes.  It also discovered a 4mm lesion that is a level 4 risk that needs to be biopsied guided by an mri.  The report said that it may be a papilloma.  Does it matter if  I continue with the general surgeon or should I see a breast specialist before the biopsy?  I think the general surgeon is saying just to remove the lesion for now, biopsy it first and then see about the lymph nodes.  Is that typical?  If it is cancerous, is it likely to have spread to the those lymph nodes already being that it's only 4 mm and didn't come up on my mammogram or ultrasound yet?  Thanks for any experience and advice.  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Just had a Breast MRI momof5 momof5
